text: Eric Weissberg (August 16, 1939 â€“ March 22, 2020) was an American singer, banjo player, and multi-instrumentalist. He was known for his banjo solo in "Dueling Banjos". It was released as a single that reached number 2 in the United States and Canada in 1973. Weissberg was a member of the folk group The Tarriers. Weissberg was born in New York City. Weussberg died on March 22, 2020 in Detroit, Michigan of Alzheimer's disease-related problems, aged 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official Eric Weissberg site Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:American guitarists Category:Country musicians from New York (state) Category:American country singers Category:Singers from New York City Category:Musicians from New York City
title: Eric Weissberg
